Key Arguments: The submission questions the definitions of misinformation and disinformation, and who decides what is true.
It argues that truth is definite, while many aspects of life are indefinite and subject to change.
The submission emphasizes the importance of free will and expression, suggesting that these should not be infringed upon.
It highlights the value of personal growth and change, suggesting that opinions and views should not be censored.
The submission suggests that the proposed legislation seeks to control indefinite and ever-changing concepts, which it argues is not feasible without infringing on free will.
Main Themes: Criticism of control over indefinite concepts
Notable Quotes: What is misinformation or disinformation? What is truth? How or who would decide this?
What this amendment seeks to do is attempt to control indefinite, ever changing concepts, ideas, data and values.
